senses.de: To be excited or eagerly await a future event or occasion.
senses.ex: I am looking forward to our trip next week.

Tips.title: Emotional Intensity
Tips.description: Conveys stronger emotion than simple anticipation, implying you're very enthusiastic about the upcoming event.
Tips.example: He's really looking forward to his birthday party.

Tips.title: Casual Tone
Tips.description: Used in casual or informal settings, such as conversations among friends or personal emails.
Tips.example: I'm looking forward to our coffee date!

Tips.title: Personal Experiences
Tips.description: Often relates to personal enjoyment or experiences, not just any routine or mundane future event.
Tips.example: I'm looking forward to seeing my favorite band live.

senses.de: To consider, plan or arrange a specific action in the future.
senses.ex: We are looking forward to working with you on this project.

Tips.title: Professional Projects
Tips.description: Common in professional or academic contexts, where it implies a positive attitude towards upcoming collaborations or tasks.
Tips.example: Our team is looking forward to launching the new product line.

Tips.title: Formal Communications
Tips.description: Suitable for formal emails or letters, often used as a polite way to express enthusiasm about future business dealings.
Tips.example: We look forward to your presentation at the conference.

Tips.title: Positive Preparations
Tips.description: Implies preparation and planning for future events with a positive outlook and readiness.
Tips.example: I look forward to preparing the annual report with your insights.
